meanings.definition: To contribute to a result or outcome.
meanings.sent1: Her hard work conduced to the success of the project.
meanings.sent2: Teamwork conduced to a positive atmosphere in the office.
meanings.sent3: His positive attitude conduced to making the meeting more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The clear instructions conduced to a smooth workflow.
meanings.sent5: The warm weather conduced to a relaxing day at the beach.

meanings.sent1: The experienced tour guide conduced the group through the historic city.
meanings.sent2: The teacher conduced the students on a field trip to the museum.
meanings.sent3: The helpful signs conduced the lost travelers back to the main road.
meanings.sent4: The compass conduced the hikers safely through the dense forest.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse conduced ships safely through the rocky waters.
